documentation_philosophy.content: Documentation organized by audience and purpose, following industry conventions
principles: Deployment docs for operators and sysadmins
Development docs for contributors and developers
README files co-located with relevant code/data

directory_structure.content: Three-tier documentation structure under docs/ directory

structure.docs/: Root documentation directory with index README

directory_structure.rationale: Follows Django, Python, and DevOps documentation conventions for clarity and discoverability

existing_documentation.content: Inventory of current documentation files and their purposes

docs/README.md.content: Overview, quick links, technology stack, architecture summary

docs/deployment/database-operations.md.purpose: Complete guide for database backup and restore on TrueNAS Scale
docs/deployment/database-operations.md.content: Dump procedures, transfer methods, restore script usage, troubleshooting

docs/development/dependencies.md.purpose: Required software and packages for development

README.md.content: Basic install instructions, warnings, Invenio setup (legacy)

backup/README.md.location_rationale: Co-located with backup directory for immediate reference

documentation_conventions.content: Naming and formatting conventions for documentation files

conventions.directory_naming: lowercase single words or kebab-case (e.g., deployment/, development/)
conventions.readme_placement: README.md in directories for directory-specific documentation
conventions.detailed_guides: Descriptive names in appropriate subdirectory (e.g., docs/deployment/database-operations.md)
conventions.cross_references: Use relative paths for internal links, absolute URLs for external

markdown_standards.headers: # for title, ## for major sections, ### for subsections
markdown_standards.code_blocks: Use triple backticks with language specification
markdown_standards.examples: Provide concrete examples with real commands
markdown_standards.warnings: Use visual indicators (âš ï¸, ðŸš¨) for important warnings
markdown_standards.structure: Include table of contents for docs > 200 lines

planned_documentation.content: Documentation to be created as project matures
high_priority: docs/deployment/update-procedures.md - Detailed code update guide with examples
docs/development/setup.md - Complete local development environment setup
docs/operations/troubleshooting.md - Common issues, error messages, solutions
medium_priority: docs/development/architecture.md - Deep dive into system architecture
docs/operations/monitoring.md - Performance monitoring and health checks
docs/operations/security.md - Security best practices and procedures
low_priority: docs/api/endpoints.md - API endpoint documentation (if not auto-generated)

documentation_maintenance.content: Process for keeping documentation current and accurate
principles: Update documentation in same commit as code changes

review_schedule.development_docs: After major dependency updates or architecture changes
review_schedule.operations_docs: Quarterly or after operational procedure changes

context_memory_relationship.content: Relationship between context memory and user-facing documentation

context_memory.purpose: AI assistant context and architectural decisions
context_memory.audience: AI assistants, lead developers understanding project history

user_documentation.update_frequency: With code changes and procedure updates

context_memory_relationship.cross_references: Context memory should reference relevant docs/ files for operational procedures
